p: One hundred and sixteen pigs (87.9%) tested positive to IAV more than once (Fig. 1) and 103 pigs (78%) had recurrent infections based on the study definition for recurrence (testing IAV positive in two non-consecutive weeks). There were two overlapping epidemic events of IAV infection during the study period (Fig. 2) with no statistical difference between the number of prevalent cases at the epidemic peaks in W2 and W7 (p = 0.24). During the 15-week period, the weekly prevalence of IAV infection ranged between 0% and 65.2% and the incidence density of IAV infection of pigs after weaning ranged between 0 and 71 cases per 100 pig-week (Table 1).
